intro: Bupleurum obtusifolium, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are broad, ovate, and have a mild, sweet scent, contributing to its common name. Bupleurum obtusifolium is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
